intro: Thlaspi martiale, commonly known as the common rock cress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, white or yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its leaves are usually alternate and pinnately divided. It is native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia, and it thrives in temperate climates. Thlaspi martiale is often found in disturbed areas, such as roadsides and gravelly fields, due to its adaptability to harsh environments.
